channel.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters 40th Annual Convention, 1964
channel.description:
These recordings featured highlights from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters 40th Annual Convention in 1964.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters 40th Annual Convention, 1964

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Engineering Standards (Reel 1)
item.description: This session offers presentations and discussions on four major technical categories: low-cost video tape recorders; vidicon and orthicon cameras; facilities planning; and technical standards and interconnection of facilities.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Keynote General Session
item.description: This session features a welcome by Austin mayor Lester E. Palmer as well as remarks by psychologist and filmmaker Lester F. Beck and William McCarter, the manager of WETA in Washington, D.C. NAEB president William G. Harley discussed the importance of dues to the organization's functions..
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Radio Session 1 - Radio Reconsidered - Tape 2
item.description: In thinking about what to call our first division day under the new regime of national educational radio, it seemed to us rather appropriate to give it the generic title of “Radio Reconsidered.” Because this is precisely what we intend to do here this morning. We want to reconsider radio in all of its facets: what we all do every day operationally, the kind of dreams and visions we have, and what we're trying to accomplish. This first session was is devoted to outstanding examples of enterprise and experimentation.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Educational Broadcasting and ETV Facilities Act Part Two
item.description: This session features speakers on the impact of the Educational Television Facilities Act of 1962, the first major federal aid to public broadcasting.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Rm 15 Session on Research: Dr. Presley Holmes, Chmn (Reel 2)
item.description: This session, entitled "Who's Doing What to Whom and Why Don't We Know about It," shares some of the research being done in radio and television and addresses the lag time between approval and reporting, which is an impediment to collaboration.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Keynote (2nd half) and General Business Session (Part I)
item.description: This session features a welcome by Austin mayor Lester E. Palmer as well as remarks by psychologist and filmmaker Lester F. Beck and William McCarter, the manager of WETA in Washington, D.C. NAEB president William G. Harley discussed the importance of dues to the organization's functions.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Fourth General Session: "Financial Resources" (Reel 2)
item.description: A continuation of the session, entitled "Untapped Financial Resources for Educational Broadcasting," supported the value proposition that the services rendered by educational television and radio should be broadened and directed to the needs--not only of those in school or those desiring cultural enrichment in their home--but to the basic needs of all elements of the whole community.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Radio Session 1 - Radio Reconsidered - Tape 3 / Radio Session 2 - International Radio Reconsidered - Tape 1
item.description: In thinking about what to call our first division day under the new regime of national educational radio, it seemed to us rather appropriate to give it the generic title of “Radio Reconsidered.” Because this is precisely what we intend to do here this morning. We want to reconsider radio in all of its facets: what we all do every day operationally, the kind of dreams and visions we have, and what we're trying to accomplish. This first session was is devoted to outstanding examples of enterprise and experimentation.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Professional Training - Room 8 - Reel 1
item.description: A discussion on the issues involved with training personnel for educational television, including the lack of adequate college programs teaching educational broadcasting or the use of television for educational purposes.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Universities and colleges

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Educational Broadcasting and NDEA
item.description: This session provides an overview of the National Defense Education Act of 1958. This far-reaching program provided such things as student loans, fellowship grants, guidance programs, programs for the purchase of equipment; and, last but not least, a twofold aspect to support research and experimentation in the uses of television, radio, motion pictures, and related media for educational purposes—and to disseminate this information by all appropriate means.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Engineering Standards (Reel 2)
item.description: This session offers presentations and discussions on four major technical categories: low-cost video tape recorders; vidicon and orthicon cameras; facilities planning; and technical standards and interconnection of facilities.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - 3rd Gen. Session Main Auditorium: copyright, (Reel 1)
item.description: This session features a panel discussion on the proposed copyright revision, one of the most complex and important problems, facing American education in general and broadcast education in particular. The panel is moderated by Fred S. Siebert, dean of the College of Communications Arts at Michigan State University.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Industrial Session Part 2
item.description: This session continues a discussion on technical and equipment issues concerning studio design and sharing educational television programming with students.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: Professional Training - Room 8 - Reel 3
item.description: A discussion on the issues involved with training personnel for educational television, including the lack of adequate college programs teaching educational broadcasting or the use of television for educational purposes.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Universities and colleges

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Fourth General Session: "Financial Resources" (Conclusion) and Final Business Session (beginning)
item.description: A continuation of the session, entitled "Untapped Financial Resources for Educational Broadcasting," supported the value proposition that the services rendered by educational television and radio should be broadened and directed to the needs--not only of those in school or those desiring cultural enrichment in their home--but to the basic needs of all elements of the whole community. This was followed by the beginning of the final business session of this year's convention.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Second General Session
item.description: The second general session of the 40th annual convention, featuring a speech by Dr. James Finn, professor of education and head of the department of instructional technology at the University of Southern California, as well as a lecture by FCC commissioner Robert T. Barley.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Radio Session 1 - Radio Reconsidered - Tape 1
item.description: In thinking about what to call our first division day under the new regime of national educational radio, it seemed to us rather appropriate to give it the generic title of “Radio Reconsidered.” Because this is precisely what we intend to do here this morning. We want to reconsider radio in all of its facets: what we all do every day operationally, the kind of dreams and visions we have, and what we're trying to accomplish. This first session was is devoted to outstanding examples of enterprise and experimentation.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - International EJ Broad around the world (Reel 2)
item.description: This session surveys international educational public broadcasting services.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Comm. Perry Col. 1 - Reel 1 - Individual Member Session
item.description: NAEB president William Harley describes the organization's new individual member division, which helps professionals achieve personal goals consistent with maximum growth and development as members of the educational broadcasting profession, and introduces Vernon Bronson, the new division's president.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Radio Session 2 - International Radio Reconsidered - Tape 2
item.description: In thinking about what to call our first division day under the new regime of national educational radio, it seemed to us rather appropriate to give it the generic title of “Radio Reconsidered.” Because this is precisely what we intend to do here this morning. We want to reconsider radio in all of its facets: what we all do every day operationally, the kind of dreams and visions we have, and what we're trying to accomplish. This first session was is devoted to outstanding examples of enterprise and experimentation.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Rm 15 Session on Research: Dr. Presley Holmes, Chmn (Reel 1)
item.description: This session, entitled "Who's Doing What to Whom and Why Don't We Know about It," shares some of the research being done in radio and television and addresses the lag time between approval and reporting, which is an impediment to collaboration.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Banquet (Reel 2)
item.description: This session features post-banquet remarks by a distinguished group of public broadcasting leaders. In this second reel is the majority of the closing speech by U.S. Information Agency Director Carl Rowan.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Educational Broadcasting and the FCC, National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.description: In this session, panelists discuss the role of the FCC in channel assignments and other issues concerning the growth of educational television stations.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Luncheon - Reel 1
item.description: This recording features a series of humorous and inspirational speakers and performances during a luncheon at the 40th-annual National Association of Educational Broadcasters convention.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: Professional Training - Room 8 - Reel 2
item.description: This session features discussion on the issues involved with training personnel for educational television, including the lack of adequate college programs teaching educational broadcasting or the use of television for educational purposes.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Universities and colleges

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention Educational Broadcasting and the FCC, National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.description: In this session, panelists discuss the role of the FCC in channel assignments and other issues concerning the growth of educational television stations.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.description: This session surveys international educational public broadcasting services.

item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention - Banquet (Reel 1)
item.description:
This session features post-banquet remarks by a distinguished group of public broadcasting leaders. Funding for production grants are announced, including for the WDET series Portrait of an American,
Award citations are then given to Cyril Braum, McCabe Day,
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Luncheon - Reel 2
item.description: This recording features a series of humorous and inspirational speakers and performances during a luncheon at the 40th-annual National Association of Educational Broadcasters convention.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention General Business Session Part 2 and Industrial Session Part 1
item.description: This continuation of the business and industrial session includes discussions of proposed changes to organizational bylaws and relationships with other institutions, including the National Community Television Association.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: United States

item.description: The conclusion of the discussion on technical and equipment issues concerning studio design and sharing educational television programming with students.
